entry.title: Forging a Knife & Survival Camping Alone in the Wilderness

media:group.media:title: Forging a Knife & Survival Camping Alone in the Wilderness
media:group.media:description:
I am heading into the woods of Alaska for 3 days with no sleeping bag or tent. I am going to sleep in a survival shelter, make a forge, make a charcoal kiln, make charcoal, forge and make a knife and do it all in extreme cold weather alone in the wilderness.

entry.title: 2 Weeks Hunting Jade, Shrimp Fishing, Indigenous Survival & More (Taiwan Travel VLOG)

media:group.media:title: 2 Weeks Hunting Jade, Shrimp Fishing, Indigenous Survival & More (Taiwan Travel VLOG)
media:group.media:description:
My Family spent 2 weeks traveling Taiwan for the first time. Its a small Island packed full of culture and adventure and amazing food. We got to go shrimp fishing in Taipei and a fishing restaurant, learning about the various indigenous cultures at a survival school in Hualien, Hunting jade in a mountain river, Climbing monkey mountain in Kaohsiung, Celebrating Christmas and New Years with a bang, some unexpected trips to the Hospital and of course we ate amazing food everywhere.
Checkout our Travel Adventure Playlist with ALL our travel videos from around the world. https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL5EGD6MqjI6KBouwBqH2IYnIaQzrGJi_u

entry.title: Rebuilding Off-Grid Cabin & Digging Well at Alaskan Homestead

media:group.media:title: Rebuilding Off-Grid Cabin & Digging Well at Alaskan Homestead
media:group.media:description:
I bought an abandoned Alaskan homestead and off-grid cabin with no water source or well. For 2 years I have been building roads, repairing buildings, fixing equipment and hauling water onto our property. For the next 3 months we are finishing some major projects and tackling our water problem.
Check out our abandoned homestead playlist for all our homestead videos - https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL5EGD6MqjI6JeDJyJ6th8K9zI-mtYnYs9

entry.title: Exploring Every Island in Hawaii - 9 weeks fishing, camping, hiking, diving & exploring

media:group.media:title: Exploring Every Island in Hawaii - 9 weeks fishing, camping, hiking, diving & exploring
media:group.media:description:
3 years ago we made a goal to visit every public island in Hawaii (The big Island, Kauai, Maui, Molokai, Lanai and Oahu). So we spent a total of 9 weeks exploring all 6 islands. We did a lot of fishing, snorkeling, diving, beach combing, camping, hiking, and just meeting the most wonderful people.
Here are links to various activities we did in order: (Hawaii) Nephi's Smokehouse Kona HI - https://www.kailuakonasmokehouse.com/
Top Shot Spear Fishing Charter https://www.topshotspearfishing.com/
Kona Snorkeling Trips (Manta Rays) https://konasnorkeltrips.com/
Big Island Divers - SCUBA Diving https://bigislanddivers.com/
Check out Ryan Myers Expedition (spear fishing YouTube Channel) https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC_GjPTzrgoy6GRW4JrsgNYQ
(Kauai) Desmon Thaine's gyotaku gallery website https://www.desmondthainfineart.com/
Desmond Thaine on Instagram @desmondthainfineart
My super-awesome novist sister's website https://www.ma-nichols.com/
Rental property we stayed at https://www.vrbo.com/1377558?unitId=1935915&childrenCount=3&noDates=true&utm_source=direct&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=earned:vrbo:sharecopylink:USA&utm_content=1377558&oc=udFi6gQh-b5y-8t3c4j41

Kalihiwai Beach: Pretty Sheltered beach we went to on Nathan's birthday https://goo.gl/maps/gDBpNvDvRH9KgzCX9

entry.title: 3 Days in Arctic Survival Shelter - Solo Bushcraft Camping & Blacksmithing.

media:group.media:title: 3 Days in Arctic Survival Shelter - Solo Bushcraft Camping & Blacksmithing.
media:group.media:description:
Winter has family come, and the muskeg is frozen. So I am taking my tracked kei truck off the beaten path to explore the frozen lakes and swamps of Alaska's interior. I am going to spend 3 days camping with out a tent, sleeping under animal hides in a bushcraft survival shelter. I am going to do some campfire cooking and do a quick bushcraft blacksmithing project around the campfire as well.

entry.title: No tent, No sleeping bag - Extreme Winter Survival Camping (0F/-18C)

media:group.media:title: No tent, No sleeping bag - Extreme Winter Survival Camping (0F/-18C)
media:group.media:description:
What is wrong with me? I spend way too much money on sleeping bags, insulated mats and hot tents and instead I go off and sleep in the snow with none of it. So yeah, I marched off a couple miles into the hills of Alaska with no tent, no sleeping bag and no tarp. I made a winter survival shelter and demonstrate the best winter time survival shelter if you don't want to freeze to death. It dropped well bellow 0F (-18C) and I cooked moose ribs and baked bread on the coals. Its a fun video so stop reading this and go give it a look.
Outdoor Boys on FACEBOOK https://www.facebook.com/TeamOutdoorBoys
Outdoor Boys on INSTAGRAM @outdoorboyschannel

entry.title: Rebuilding Off-Grid Cabin at our Abandoned Homestead (prepping for Alaska's winter)

media:group.media:title: Rebuilding Off-Grid Cabin at our Abandoned Homestead (prepping for Alaska's winter)
media:group.media:description:
Last year we bought an off grid Alaskan homestead that was full of abandoned tools and equipment. And soon after, one of the buildings caught fire and almost burned to the ground. We have spent the last year repairing the electrical system, building an all season ATV trail into the property and replacing a collapsed garage and finally its time to build that burned cabin into a proper bunk house. But winter is right around the corner so its a race to get the project done before the extreme snow and cold sets in.
check out the entire abandoned homestead video series on our playlist here https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PL5EGD6MqjI6JeDJyJ6th8K9zI-mtYnYs9&si=_CLNrL6j8yYUHcnA

entry.title: Solo Winter Bushcraft Camping in Alaska

media:group.media:title: Solo Winter Bushcraft Camping in Alaska
media:group.media:description:
I took a helicopter from Talkeetna Alaska to a remote section of river at the base of Mt. Denali. There I set up camp for 3 days of cold weather solo camping and bushcraft. However, when the temperature suddenly dropped well bellow freezing, the river began to freeze up and getting home meant riding a frozen river of ice.
Talkeetna Air Taxi https://www.talkeetnaair.com/

entry.title: 6 Days Jungle Survival Camping with NO Food - US Marine Corps Jungle Survival School

media:group.media:title: 6 Days Jungle Survival Camping with NO Food - US Marine Corps Jungle Survival School
media:group.media:description:
8 Months ago I found the US Marine Corps Jungle Survival school in Okinawa Japan on Google Maps. So I reached out to the USMC and asked if I could attend the school and film the experience and they said "Yes". Prior to arriving to Okinawa I knew Very Very little about what actually happens at the USMC Jungle Survival school and boy was I in for a surprise.
I was attached with their leadership course, a more rigorous course for team and squad level leaders. Its a 5 week course that teaches repelling and crossing extreme terrain, how to treat and evacuate casualties in the jungle and spends a lot of time on jungle tactics. The fourth week of the training is all about survival in jungle environment. So I joined about 30 marines for survival school portion of their training.
For survival week, we were not allowed to bring food, caffeine, nicotine tabaco, spare cloths, tents, sleeping bag and most every creature comfort you would want in the jungle. There were 6 items we were allowed and a few items like tarps were we allowed only 1 per team.
I was deeply impressed by the all the students and instructors I met during my week with the USMC and am really grateful that I got to spend a week with them.
For more information about the the US Marine Corps Jungle Survival School and the 3rd Marine Division in Okinawa check out:
USMC 3D Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/3dmardiv?igsh=YnRjYzEzNTd0dzNl
USMC 3D Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/3dMarineDivision
USMC 3D Twitter/X: https://x.com/3d_marine_div?s=21&t=n1m2Cjqfd_3Kh2WU6P8Odw

entry.title: 4 Days in Alaskan Yupik Village - Moose Hunting, Fishing & Spearing Seals with Atlatls

media:group.media:title: 4 Days in Alaskan Yupik Village - Moose Hunting, Fishing & Spearing Seals with Atlatls
media:group.media:description:
I was invited to the Yupik village of Kotlik Alaska by my friend Sam and we spent 4 days hunting and fishing and learning about the Yupik culture. We harvested a moose for to give to patients at the Native hospital in Anchorage Alaska, we hunted seals with the traditional atlatl and spear. Set gill nets, caught salmon and sheefish and learned about Yupik culture.
If you want to see my interview on Kotlik QTV broadcasting check their facebook for updates. https://www.facebook.com/kotlikfalcons
If you are interested in donating traditional foods to Alaska Native Medical Center, please contact (907) 729-2682 or send an email to nativefood4life@anthc.org.

media:group.media:title: 3 Days Solo Camping, Fishing, Hunting & Foraging Food in Arctic
media:group.media:description:

entry.title: 4 Months at Our Off-Grid Cabin & Homestead in Alaska

media:group.media:title: 4 Months at Our Off-Grid Cabin & Homestead in Alaska
media:group.media:description:
1 year ago I bought an off grid homestead and cabin that was full of abandoned property. And we have spent the last 4 months working hard on the property to get repairs and projects done before winter. Summer is a busy time in Alaska, so as soon as the snow starts to melt we got to work on our abandoned homestead. We are finishing our new garage to replace the one that was crushed by the snow. Repairing the cabin that caught on fire last summer. Demolishing an old log cabin. Building roads. Working on ATV's and a lot more. 4 months worth of footage from our first full summer at the off grid cabin.
